intro: Dissotis tristemmoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf marshmallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in dense inflorescences, which bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, swampy habitats and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Its fibrous roots and succulent leaves make it an important species in wetland ecosystems.
